results.title: Aboriginal dreaming stories
results.brief_description: Jointly presented by Francis Firebrace Jones and Paulin Mcleod, these stories are presented with great enthusiasm and in the spirit of enhancing respect for the land and the Aboriginal people of Australia. The story titles are: In the beginning ; Creation of day and night ; Who discovered Australia? ; How fire came to Earth ; Giant Goanna and the Little black snake ; Why does the kookaburra laugh ; Old bush turkey ; Sharing time ; How the kangaroo got its pouch ; The Platypus ; Death of a cockatoo ; Walkabout ; The Bunyip ; “the Wallagara Man.

results.title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.

results.title: Fuji, thirty seven views
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Once a sacred Shinto site that drew devout pilgrims, Fuji is seen to be ringed by polluting industries, littered with trash, and topped by crassly commercial souvenir stands and fast food sheds. For residents of Tokyo, Fuji used to be a daily sight; today, because of the smog, they rarely see it. Later as he explores Tokyo, Keith Adam muses on how industrial development has cut the people off from more than just the sight of Fuji but also from what it once stood for. Shinto traditions have disappeared into pragmatic secularism; close-knit, communal neighbourhoods have given way to cramped, impersonal high-rise apartments, agricultural land and open spaces are being overwhelmed by industrial plants that pollute without thought for the future. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Ablett: one special season
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips, Dean Shiel and Australian Football Video
results.brief_description: In one special season Gary Ablett redefined the way Australian Rules football’s rich history will judge him. Having set standards rarely matched by other players since his career began, Ablett’s 1993 was quite extraordinary - even for a man prone to producing the extraordinary. We follow Ablett’s path through the season, hear him speak on his performance and his place in the Geelong team and travel to Nauru with him as he umpires the local Grand Final. This is a fine tribute to one of the legends of the game.

results.title: Abel Gance: yesterday and tomorrow = Abel Gance: hier et demain
results.creator_credit: R. Picon-Borel, N. Kaplan, D Harispe, Q. Ciarlo, Nelly Kaplan and Office de Documentation par Film
results.brief_description: Yesterday and Tomorrow is a French/English dubbed documentary which summarizes Abel Gance’s entire career, from his days working initially as an actor in the film industry, up until 1963, the year this program was made. The documentary shows excerpts of his films including shorts like “La Folie du Docteur Tube” (1915). It is narrated through “the words of Gance”, who explains how his career was plagued with tragedy and little recognition.

results.title: ABC for kids: bumper collection
results.brief_description: A collection of children’s classic television for the very young to enjoy. “Invisible Bananas” and “Teddy chase”, the lovable Bananas In Pyjamas have fun with the teddies in these two episodes. “Postman Pat and the suit of armour”, Postman Pat helps get Garner Hall ready to be open to the public. “The Kite”, Brum the little car helps to rescue a runaway kite. “Where’s Spot?” and “Spot follows his nose”, little Spot the dog hides from his mum and looks for something that smells nice in these two episodes. “Thomas comes to breakfast” and “Four Little Engines”, Thomas the Tank Engine and Friends get up to mischief in these two episodes. “Hey hey Blinky Bill”, “Whistle Song” and “Earthquake”, two songs with Blinky Bill followed by an episode about his gang getting stuck in an old mine. “Pingu as chef” and “Pingu as baby sitter”, enjoy Pingu the penguin’s adventures as he pops popcorn and then looks after twin babies in these two episodes. “Party at Owl’s House”, join in the party with Little Bear and his friends as they have a “because” party.

results.title: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Max Gordon and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the Pulitzer Prize-winning play by American author and playwright, Robert E. Sherwood, this film version captures the essence and fervour of one of America’s most memorable periods in its founding history. It takes a biographical slice of time out of Abraham Lincoln’s (Raymond Massey) life beginning with his early adult years as a woodsman, to his courtships first with Ann Rutledge (Mary Howard) and then with Mary Todd (Ruth Gordon), his eventual wife, through to years of law practice and finally to his election as President and the Declaration of Independence. Cast also includes Gene Lockhart, Howard da Silva and Alan Baxter.

results.title: ABC
results.brief_description: Visually suggests the origins of the English alphabet from the signs and symbols used by the Egyptians, Semitic, Phoenoecian, Greek, Roman and Medieval people. Could be used in a wide variety of applications including studies of signs and symbols, graphic communications, art, language arts.

results.title: Abbott and Costello in Hollywood
results.creator_credit: S. Sylvan Simon, Martin A. Gosch, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Abbott and Costello play a pair of barbers who want their own Hollywood barber shop and to get it no two barbers have ever been in more close shaves. There’s Abbott-the-schemer who gets them jobs as big-time talent agents. Then there’s Costello, all he’s ever headed for is trouble. When Abbott and Costello get inside Hollywood, Hollywood gets turned inside out.
